Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the presence of a "real" Spider-Man on a rooftop, when in fact it was a figurine installed by a Japanese water company.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or coordinates to verify the existence of the Spider-Man on the rooftop.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Spider-Man spotted on Google Earth is real without providing any evidence or confirmation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the presence of the Spider-Man figurine, such as it being a promotional display or artwork by the water company.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that there were two Spider-Man figurines on the building, not just one as shown in the video.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Spider-Man on the rooftop was not real but a figurine installed by the water company.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing enough information or context about the Spider-Man figurine and its purpose.
